text: I wrote earlier that my account was closed without explanation and I wasn’t sure why. Eventually I found out why they closed my account and they ended up opening the account again. I was making (way) too many requests on the REST api and that is why I was banned.

elements.text: I wrote earlier that my account was closed without explanation and I wasn’t sure why. Eventually I found out why they closed my account and they ended up opening the account again. I was making (way) too many requests on the REST api and that is why I was banned.

text: The way it happened was that I had an idea for a strategy and made a small trial using the rest api. It worked well and so I scaled it to most event types without making a proper implementation first. They didn’t notice for a while (and I didn’t realize I was making a retarded number of requests) and then they cut me.

elements.text: The way it happened was that I had an idea for a strategy and made a small trial using the rest api. It worked well and so I scaled it to most event types without making a proper implementation first. They didn’t notice for a while (and I didn’t realize I was making a retarded number of requests) and then they cut me.

text: So now I am back! Going to do this streaming thing.

elements.text: So now I am back! Going to do this streaming thing.

text: <@UU1URJ8L8> thats good to hear! Would have been good if they simply told you that upfront though!

elements.text: thats good to hear! Would have been good if they simply told you that upfront though!

text: I was looking at the streaming <https://github.com/liampauling/betfair/blob/master/examples/examplestreaming.py|example>.  Does the  `stream.subscribe_to_markets`  subscribe once to the current live markets that meet the specification, or does it continue to subscribe to new markets that also meet the specification as more markets come online?

elements.text: I was looking at the streaming
example
.  Does the
stream.subscribe_to_markets
subscribe once to the current live markets that meet the specification, or does it continue to subscribe to new markets that also meet the specification as more markets come online?

text: the latter, you subscribe and then new markets are added once available with bflw doing the hard work

elements.text: the latter, you subscribe and then new markets are added once available with bflw doing the hard work

text: Nice one. A shame they were so mysterious about it to begin with

text:
If it helps I was told this...

```Your account was closed due to your excessive amount of reading for your level of betting activity. You have made over 150 million data requests to the exchange which is not acceptable given your level of betting and this volume of reading is deemed to be for commercial usage. ```
That is probably over around a year to 18 months

That is probably over around a year to 18 months

text:
Hi,

I have the following questions, as far as I am aware William Hill API generates system delay on placing single/multple bets:
• Does betfair exchange API has it?
• So have you ever try to negate/remove this delay?

elements.text:
Hi,

I have the following questions, as far as I am aware William Hill API generates system delay on placing single/multple bets:
Does betfair exchange API has it?
So have you ever try to negate/remove this delay?

text: There is a delay when betting in running on Betfair

elements.text: There is a delay when betting in running on Betfair

text: I would imagine that trying to circumvent the delay would be instantly bannable

elements.text: I would imagine that trying to circumvent the delay would be instantly bannable

text: maybe try it and report back findings? :wink:

elements.text: maybe try it and report back findings?

text:
I guess it will be, but just wondering if someone have tried to negate it.
Thank you tho for your answer.

elements.text:
I guess it will be, but just wondering if someone have tried to negate it.
Thank you tho for your answer.

text: Used to be a bug where the funds validation would occur after the delay, this meant you could place an order and if you didn’t want it to enter the matcher transfer all your funds to another wallet and the place request would error

elements.text: Used to be a bug where the funds validation would occur after the delay, this meant you could place an order and if you didn’t want it to enter the matcher transfer all your funds to another wallet and the place request would error

text: Was the fix just checking the funds before the delay?

elements.text: Was the fix just checking the funds before the delay?

text: I believe so

elements.text: I believe so
